gov.nasa.larcfm.ACCoRD

Interface GenericBands

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    GenericDHStateBands, GenericIntentBands, GenericStateBands
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bands, ConflictBandsTwoTimes, IntentBands, KinematicBands, KinematicIntentBands, KinematicMultiBands, TripleBands

    public interface GenericBands
    This provides an interface to classes for various conflict prevention bands. The methods for adding ownship and traffic information are described in subclass interfaces GenericStateBands and GenericIntentBands. The input to these objects is the position and velocity of the ownship, the output is ranges of guidance maneuvers: track angles, ground speeds, and vertical speeds.

    • Method Detail

      • isLatLon

        boolean isLatLon()
        Returns whether the aircraft positions are specified in latitude/longitude or Euclidean coordinates. If the ownship has not been set, then this value is undefined.

      • setLookaheadTime

        void setLookaheadTime(double d,
                      java.lang.String unit)
        Sets the (relative) lookahead time [s]. Any existing bands information is cleared. If there are more than one lookahead times, this sets the nearest time.

      • getLookahedTime

        double getLookahedTime(java.lang.String unit)
        Returns the lookahead time [s] If there are more than one lookahead times, this gets the nearest time.

      • setMaxGroundSpeed

        void setMaxGroundSpeed(double gs,
                       java.lang.String unit)
        This method sets the range of ground speeds that are produced by bands. The range is 0..maxGroundSpeed in knots. When this method is executed any existing bands information is cleared.

      • getMaxGroundSpeed

        double getMaxGroundSpeed(java.lang.String unit)
        Returns the maximum ground speed in knots

      • setMaxVerticalSpeed

        void setMaxVerticalSpeed(double vs,
                         java.lang.String unit)
        Sets the range of vertical speeds that are produced by bands. -max_vs to max_vs in feet/min. When this method is executed, any existing bands information is cleared.

      • getMaxVerticalSpeed

        double getMaxVerticalSpeed(java.lang.String unit)
        Returns the range of vertical speeds output by bands in feet/min.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear all band information.

      • trackLength

        int trackLength()
        Return the number of bands of track angles

      • track

        Interval track(int i,
               java.lang.String unit)
        Return the i-th interval of the track band in the given unit.

      • trackRegion

        BandsRegion trackRegion(int i)
        Return the region type of the i-th track band. If a single time version of bands is used, then [NEAR|NONE] is returned. If a version of bands with two times is used, then [NEAR|MID|NONE] is returned.

      • regionOfTrack

        BandsRegion regionOfTrack(double trk,
                          java.lang.String unit)
        Return the region type of the given track angle [degrees, clockwise from true north]. Angles outside of 0..360 return NEAR. If a single time version of bands is used, then [NEAR|NONE] is returned. If a version of bands with two times is used, then [NEAR|MID|NONE] is returned.

      • groundSpeedLength

        int groundSpeedLength()
        Return the number of bands of ground speeds

      • groundSpeed

        Interval groundSpeed(int i,
                     java.lang.String unit)
        Return i-th interval of the ground speed band in the given unit.

      • groundSpeedRegion

        BandsRegion groundSpeedRegion(int i)
        Return the region type of the i-th ground speed band. If a single time version of bands is used, then [NEAR|NONE] is returned. If a version of bands with two times is used, then [NEAR|MID|NONE] is returned.

      • regionOfGroundSpeed

        BandsRegion regionOfGroundSpeed(double gs,
                                java.lang.String unit)
        Return the region type of the given ground speed [knot], out of range speeds are returned as NEAR. If a single time version of bands is used, then [NEAR|NONE] is returned. If a version of bands with two times is used, then [NEAR|MID|NONE] is returned.

      • verticalSpeedLength

        int verticalSpeedLength()
        Return the number of bands of vertical speeds

      • verticalSpeed

        Interval verticalSpeed(int i,
                       java.lang.String unit)
        Return the i-th interval of the vertical speed band in the given unit.

      • verticalSpeedRegion

        BandsRegion verticalSpeedRegion(int i)
        Return the region type of the i-th vertical speed band. If a single time version of bands is used, then [NEAR|NONE] is returned. If a version of bands with two times is used, then [NEAR|MID|NONE] is returned.

      • regionOfVerticalSpeed

        BandsRegion regionOfVerticalSpeed(double vs,
                                  java.lang.String unit)
        Return the region type of the given vertical speed [feet/min], out of range speeds are returned as NEAR. If a single time version of bands is used, then [NEAR|NONE] is returned. If a version of bands with two times is used, then [NEAR|MID|NONE] is returned.
